property.name: text
property.value: Simulate N bodies with gravitational forces between them. The initialPositions and initialVelocities parameters provide initial velocities and positions, and the numberOfBodies parameter specifies the number of bodies.

property.name: text
property.value: The BodyModels actor is a higher-order actors, specifically the MultiInstanceComposite. The model inside that actor is replicated a number of times given by numberOfBodies and mapped over the inputs. The inputs are copies of the positions array (which is an array of arrays) and the outputs are new positions for each of the bodies.

property.name: text
property.value: This model calculates the force on a single body and then performs a double integration to get a new position. The input is an array with the positions of all the bodies.

property.name: text
property.value: Sum the forces from each of the bodies. Note that this could be modified to support multiple masses.

property.name: text
property.value: Simple forward-Euler integration to calculate velocity from acceleration.

property.name: text
property.value: Simple forward-Euler integration to calculate position from velocity.
